Core

Class DBContextMegaPD

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core.DBContextMegaPD

  • public final class DBContextMegaPD
extends java.lang.Object

    DBContextMegaPD is the class responsible for handling the connection and interaction with the DB

    In order to use this class it first needs to be initialized. To initialize it you need to:

    new DBContextMegaPD().setHost(host)
    .setDB(dbName)
    .setAuth(username, password)
    .connect();

     

    after being initialized once, all it has to be done to access the connection is:

    DBContextMegaPD var = DBContextMegaPD.getDBContext();

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Connect to the database as long as the
        [host] as been defined
        [database] as been defined
        [authentication] as been defined
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there's already a connection in progress
        com.mysql.cj.exceptions.UnableToConnectException - if host/database/authentication was not set OR couldn't access the database

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Puts the servers status Offline and disconnects from the remote database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDBContext

        public static DBContextMegaPD getDBContext()
        Static method for access from anywhere, as long as there's a connection already established
        Returns:
        Context for the connection already in progress
        Throws:
        com.mysql.cj.exceptions.UnableToConnectException - if there's no connection in progress

      • registerServer

        public int registerServer(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String ip,
                          int connPort)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method register the base Server info in the database
        Parameters:
        name - identification name to register in the DB
        ip - identification IP of the server
        connPort - TCP port to accept connections
        Returns:
        serverID
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception -
        if it can't register the Server properly (1st)
        or if it was already registered
